headline: Why United Parcel Service Stock Slumped by 5% on Tuesday
summary: The logistics sector is not currently in favor with investors, to put it mildly, and United Parcel Service (NYSE: UPS) stock was bearing the brunt of this on Tuesday.  The lingering disappointment of a peer's quarterly earnings report, fears about the damaging effects of aggressive tariffs, and a pundit's price target cut sent UPS's shares down on the second trading day of the week; they closed the session more than 5% lower in price.  The immediate catalyst was that price target reduction.

headline: UPS Stock Is Dropping. The Reason Is Odd.
summary: Shares of shipper  United Parcel Service  had a bad day Tuesday, and while there is one thing to pin declines on, it didn’t appear to be a big deal.  UPS  stock closed down 5% at 109.95, while the  added 0.2% and the  finished flat.  The $4 cut moved the average price target by less than 20 cents.

headline: Market Outlook: Is It ‘Blast Off’ Time?
summary: As I write Monday morning, stocks are exploding higher on hopes of lighter-than-expected tariffs. The optimism began last Friday when President Trump told reporters that there will be “flexibility” in his tariff plans. From Trump:InvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice & Trading Tips People are coming to me and talking about tariffs, and a lot of people are asking me if they could have exceptions.
